# NSPDFInfo

**Class**

An object that stores information associated with the creation of a PDF file, such as its URL, tag names, page orientation, and paper size.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSPDFInfo
```

## Overview

Typically, a PDF panel—that is, a panel created by an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPDFPanel] object—displays the information supplied by an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPDFInfo] object when the user wants to export content as a PDF file. A PDF panel can also update a PDF info object with information it receives from the user.

## Specifying PDF Information

- **url**: The URL identifying the location at which the PDF file will be created.
- **isFileExtensionHidden**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the file extension should appear after the filename.
- **tagNames**: An array of tag names that should be applied to the PDF file after it’s created.
- **orientation**: The paper orientation to use when exporting content as a PDF file.
- **paperSize**: The paper size to use when exporting content as a PDF file.
- **attributes**: A dictionary of additional attributes that describe how to export content as a PDF file.

## Vector Formats

- **NSPDFImageRep**: An object that can render an image from a PDF format data stream.
- **NSEPSImageRep**: An object that can render an image from encapsulated PostScript (EPS) code.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
